title: 105_s923
content: Section 1 prohibits the interment or memorialization in certain federal cemeteries of individuals who have committed federal or state capital crimes. The appropriate Federal official is prohibited from burying or honoring individuals who have committed federal or state capital crimes in certain federal cemeteries unless written notice of the conviction or finding is received before approval of the application. The appropriate Federal official is prohibited from burying or honoring individuals who have committed federal or state capital crimes in certain federal cemeteries unless written notice of the conviction or finding is received before approval of the application. A person referred to in subsection (a) includes those convicted of Federal or State capital crimes and those found to have committed such crimes but not convicted due to being unavailable for trial. The appropriate Federal official is required to make findings based on clear and convincing evidence before allowing individuals convicted of federal or state capital crimes to be buried or honored in certain federal cemeteries. The terms Federal capital crime and State capital crime are defined, and the appropriate Federal officials are specified. The table of sections in chapter 24 of the title is amended to include a new item prohibiting the interment or memorialization in federal cemeteries of individuals convicted of Federal or State capital crimes. Effective Date for Section 2411 of title 38, United States Code, added by the Act, applies to applications for interment or memorialization made after the Act's enactment. Section 2408 of title 38, United States Code is amended to include a new subsection requiring states receiving grants for veterans' cemeteries to prohibit the interment or memorialization of certain individuals as specified in section 2411(b) of the title. The amendment to Section 2408 of title 38, United States Code requires states receiving grants for veterans' cemeteries to notify state officials and make findings as specified in subsection (b)(3) of the section.
